Generation I.Red: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
Generation I.Yellow: Its entire body is a snowy-white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
Generation I.Stadium: It stores thermal energy inside its pure white, fur-covered body. It swims in frigid water at eight knots.

Generation II.Gold: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
Generation II.Silver: It loves frigid seas with ice floes. It uses its long tail to change swimming direction quickly.
Generation II.Crystal: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it's cold.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It loves frigid seas with ice floes. It uses its long tail to change swimming direction quickly. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pok é mon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It's especially fond of Wishiwashi.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it’s colder.
Generation IX.Violet: It stores thermal energy in its body to fend off the cold. It swims at eight knots even in frigid waters.
